## invariant() function

Throws an error of the specified type with the given message if the condition is not met.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function invariant<TError extends Error = Error>(condition: boolean | (() => boolean), message: string | (() => string), errorClass?: Type<TError>, logger?: LoggerService): asserts condition;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

condition


</td><td>

boolean \| (() =&gt; boolean)


</td><td>

The condition to check or a function that return the condition.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

message


</td><td>

string \| (() =&gt; string)


</td><td>

The error message to throw if the condition is false.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

errorClass


</td><td>

Type&lt;TError&gt;


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ An optional error class to throw if the item is undefined. Defaults to `Error`


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

logger


</td><td>

LoggerService


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ An optional logger service to log the error message if the condition is false.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

asserts condition
